topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542c8bf963687216e2ac0000#post_542c8bf963687216e2ac0000
People talk about how the USA doesn't have a culture like it's a bad thing, but when you think about it it's probably one of the few countries were multiculturalism actually works.  What I mean by this(yes I know I say this a lot) is let's look at race for a second in the usa; in two generations the usa will no longer be white majority, rather everyone's just going to be multi-racial and you know what?  It actually works here; sure there's still problems in the usa, but you don't see people firebombing hundreds of cars, you don't see nationwide violent protests with looting, you don't see fucking neo-nazis gaining a fair chunk of political control in congress and so forth.


A prime example of a changing demographic right now in the usa is asians; over the last decade the asian population in the usa has doubled and at this rate there could very well be as many asians as african americans in the next decade or two.

[bq="Shadow_the_Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542c8e7e6368724ac9f40000#post_542c8e7e6368724ac9f40000
Multi-racial... give thanks to the inmigrants.[/bq]
Pretty much.

Also I have to correct something I was wrong about; the asian population in the usa has doubled in three years, not ten.  Asians are the primary driving force behind the current population boom right now.  Contrary to popular belief hispanics aren't immigrating to the usa nearly as much as they were; the reason why hispanics are on the rise is because they're having children in the usa now and thus hispanic children being born = more hispanics.


Tl:dr; at this rate in about twenty years the usa will be truly multicultural with no real majority race.
